snippet: The Ephesus Seventh-Day Adventist Church at Lenox Avenue and West 123rd Street has paid off a $550,000 mortgage that it took out to restore the exterior of its building, including a reinstallation of its steeple top.
abstract: The Ephesus Seventh-Day Adventist Church at Lenox Avenue and West 123rd Street has paid off a $550,000 mortgage that it took out to restore the exterior of its building, including a reinstallation of its steeple top.
lead_paragraph: Let's say something good about mortgages.

headline.main: Under a New Steeple, a Harlem Church Gets Out From Under Debt
